media.item: Email Template Manager: Emails need pages no more

releases.release: - [#98](https://github.com/michael-e/email_template_manager/issues/98): Superfluous "missing recipient" messages in log file

- Add note on compatibility to the README - [#96](https://github.com/michael-e/email_template_manager/issues/96): Always interpret commas as attachment separators - Implement "from" logic (fake "From" header field) - Improve structure and formatting of README
- Prevent undefined index
- PHP 7.2 compatibility
- Add delegates before and after output generation - Remove php-min and php-max attributes
- Do not return false when parsing properties (#94)
- Allow HTTP(S) URLs for attachments
- Allow attachments to be optional (requires Symphony 2.7)
- Several fixes and improvements
- Minor fixes, cleanup
- Supported on PHP 7 - Fix compilation error with preview for Windows and Unix (see #2375) - Fix params when override parent
- Implement attachments logic
- Fix for adding POST parameters when field has an array/complicated structure (thanks @jonmifsud) - Fix recipients parsing; split string after (not before) XPath parsing (thanks @jonmifsud)
- Code formatting and minor fixes - Added support for different admin URL - Marked as compatible with Symphony 2.x.x
- Be more careful with variable type.
- Modernized code formatting. - Fixed issue with duplicate emails (#80).
- Removed XSLT editors.
- Fix for #72: Use method detection for retrieving the author object.
- Bugfix: Fatal error when saving templates
- Bugfixes - Symphony 2.4 compatibility
- Include Post Data as Params (thanks @korelogic)
- 2.3 compatibility, finally.
- Added 2.3 compatibility
- Made template inlcude paths work as expected. Requires updating include paths!

- Added looping over recipients, so multiple customised emails are possible - Moved filter preferences from POST values to configuration menu - Added recipients and reply-to values to generate() function - Added compatibility with the Members extension
- Fixed sorting order of event filters - Fixed bug with field[] syntax in frontend - Fixed bug with demo code with more than one template installed
- SQL Injection flaw fixed
- Event filters are supported, so custom events are no longer needed to send emails. - It is possible to select which layouts to use (Html, Plain or both).
- Initial release.
